approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: This project aims to develop a portal/dashboard for the VKYC team to independently fetch V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements, eliminating the current manual request process to the IT data server team.
project_goals: To enable the VKYC team to fetch V-KYC recordings on demand.
To provide a self-service portal for VKYC recording retrieval.
To streamline the process of accessing VKYC recordings for audit and internal purposes.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the VKYC team relies on manual requests to the IT data server team to retrieve VKYC recordings stored on the LTF 'NFS (Network File System)' server for internal and external audit requirements. This manual process is inefficient and time-consuming, necessitating a more automated and accessible solution.

requirements.description: A portal/Dashboard shall be created for VKYC recording access.
Access to the portal shall be provided to VKYC process leads (TL & Process Manager).
All approved PL-VKYC case recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be available for retrieval as and when required.
Recordings shall be available to view/download filtered by date, month, and year.
Recordings shall be searchable by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file for bulk video download.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall contain a list of LAN IDs (minimum 2, maximum 50).
The uploaded file format for bulk download shall be CSV or TXT.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk request.
Upon receiving a response from the backend, results shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The tabular display shall include a 'Download All' option for the displayed records.
Table pagination shall display only 10 records at a time.
Bulk download shall download only 10 records at a time.
Clicking on a single LAN ID in the table shall initiate the recording download for that specific LAN ID.
Access to the portal screen shall be restricted to very limited users (only Team Leaders).

functional_requirements: A portal/Dashboard to be created for VKYC recording access.
Access to the portal to be provided to VKYC process leads (TL & Process Manager).
All approved PL-VKYC case recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be available for retrieval as and when required.
Recordings shall be available to view/download filtered by date, month, and year.
Recordings shall be searchable by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file for bulk video download.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall contain a list of LAN IDs (minimum 2, maximum 50).
The uploaded file format for bulk download shall be CSV or TXT.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk request.
Upon receiving a response from the backend, results shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The tabular display shall include a 'Download All' option for the displayed records.
Table pagination shall display only 10 records at a time.
Bulk download shall download only 10 records at a time.
Clicking on a single LAN ID in the table shall initiate the recording download for that specific LAN ID.
non_functional_requirements: Access to the portal screen shall be restricted to very limited users (only Team Leaders).
stakeholders: B. Ops â€“ V-KYC Team (Process Owner)
success_criteria: VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers can independently access and download VKYC recordings via the portal.
The portal successfully retrieves and displays VKYC recordings based on date, month, year, and LAN ID search.
The bulk download functionality processes uploaded files and allows downloading of specified recordings.
The system effectively integrates with the backend API for data retrieval.
constraints: The uploaded file for bulk download must be in CSV or TXT format.
The uploaded file for bulk download must contain a minimum of 2 LAN IDs.
The uploaded file for bulk download must contain a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
Table pagination will display only 10 records at a time.
Bulk downloads will be limited to 10 records at a time.
Access to the portal is restricted to VKYC Team Leaders and Process Managers.
assumptions: VKYC recordings are consistently present and accessible on the LTF 'NFS (Network File System)' server.
A backend API exists or will be developed to process requests for VKYC recordings from the NFS server.
The 'LAN ID' is a unique identifier for VKYC cases and can be used to retrieve associated recordings.
The 'V-KKYC approved date' is available for IT usage for cross-checking purposes.
risks: Data security risks if access controls are not robustly implemented.
Performance issues with bulk download functionality, especially with large recording files.
Availability and reliability of the existing NFS server for fetching recordings.
Integration challenges with the backend API or the NFS server.
Accuracy of LAN IDs provided in bulk upload files leading to incorrect downloads.

domain_specific_details.VKYC: Video Know Your Customer - a process involving video verification.
domain_specific_details.LAN ID: A unique identifier likely associated with customer accounts or cases.
domain_specific_details.NFS Server: Network File System server where VKYC recordings are currently stored.
domain_specific_details.PL-VKYC cases: Approved Personal Loan VKYC cases, indicating a specific type of VKYC recording.

recommendations: Add detailed Non-Functional Requirements, especially regarding performance (e.g., response times for search/download), scalability, and security (e.g., data encryption, audit trails).
Specify error handling mechanisms for file uploads, API calls, and cases where recordings are not found.
Clarify the purpose and usage of 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)'.
Provide more detailed UI/UX specifications beyond the basic table layout.
Address data retention policies for recordings on the portal (if applicable).

identified_gaps: Lack of detailed Non-Functional Requirements (performance, scalability, availability, detailed security beyond access control).
Absence of specified error handling and messaging for user actions (e.g., invalid file upload, API failure).
No detailed interface changes or testing requirements.
No mention of technology stack or architectural considerations.
No data retention or archival policy for recordings on the portal.
No detailed user stories or use cases beyond the high-level functional descriptions.
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct workshops with stakeholders to define and document comprehensive Non-Functional Requirements.
Define specific error handling scenarios and user feedback mechanisms.
Clarify if any reporting capabilities are needed in the future, even if not immediate.
Develop detailed test cases and scenarios for all functionalities, including edge cases.
Outline the proposed system architecture and technology stack.
Define data lifecycle management for recordings accessed via the portal.
